User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The LabTracker software helps (i) doctors manage the requisition of tests and examinations for patients and (ii) patients book appointments for tests and examinations at a lab. For the remainder of this description, tests and examinations are used interchangeably. 

For a requisition, a doctor must provide their numeric practitioner number and signature for verification as well as their full name, their address, and their phone number. The signature is a digital signature, i.e., an image of the actual signature of the doctor. Furthermore, the doctor indicates the date from which the requisition is valid. The requisition must also show the patient?? information including their alpha-numeric health number, first name and last name, date of birth, address, and phone number. A doctor cannot prescribe a test for themselves but can prescribe tests to someone else who is a doctor. 

Several tests can be combined on one requisition but only if they belong to the same group of tests. For example, only blood tests can be combined on one requisition or only ultrasound examinations can be combined. It is not possible to have a blood test and an ultrasound examination on the same requisition. For each test, its duration is defined by the lab network, so that it is possible to schedule appointments accordingly. The duration of a test is the same at each lab. For some kinds of tests, it does not matter how many tests are performed. They take as long as a single test. For example, several blood tests can be performed on a blood sample, i.e., it takes as long to draw the blood sample for a single blood test as it does for several blood tests. 

A doctor may also indicate that the tests on a requisition are to be repeated for a specified number of times and interval. The interval is either weekly, monthly, every half year, or yearly. All tests on a requisition are following the same repetition pattern. 

The doctor and the patient can view the results of each test (either negative or positive) as well as the accompanying report. 

A patient is required to make an appointment for some tests while others are walk-in only. For example, x-ray examinations require an appointment, but blood tests are walk-in only (i.e., it is not possible to make an appointment for a blood test). On the other hand, some tests only require a sample to be dropped off (e.g., a urine or stool sample). 

To make an appointment for a requisition, a patient selects the desired lab based on the lab?? address and business hours. For requisitions with repeated tests, a patient is only allowed to make one appointment at a time. The confirmation for an appointment also shows a confirmation number, the date as well as start/end times, and the name of the lab as well as its registration number. It is possible to change or cancel an appointment at any time but doing so within 24 hours of the appointment incurs a change/cancellation fee. Each lab determines its own fee and business hours. All labs are open every day of the year and offer all tests. The business hours of a lab do not change from one week to the next. Each day a lab is open from the day?? start time to its end time, i.e., there are no breaks. 

AI:### Enumerations:
1. TestType
   - BLOOD
   - ULTRASOUND
   - XRAY
   - URINE
   - STOOL

2. RepetitionInterval
   - WEEKLY
   - MONTHLY
   - HALF_YEARLY
   - YEARLY

3. TestResult
   - NEGATIVE
   - POSITIVE

### Classes:
1. Doctor
   - Attributes:
     - practitionerNumber: numeric
     - signature: image
     - fullName: string
     - address: string
     - phoneNumber: string

2. Patient
   - Attributes:
     - healthNumber: alphanumeric
     - firstName: string
     - lastName: string
     - dateOfBirth: date
     - address: string
     - phoneNumber: string

3. Requisition
   - Attributes:
     - doctor: Doctor
     - patient: Patient
     - tests: List<Test>
     - repeatTimes: int
     - repetitionInterval: RepetitionInterval

4. Test
   - Attributes:
     - testType: TestType
     - duration: int

5. Appointment
   - Attributes:
     - labAddress: string
     - labBusinessHours: string
     - confirmationNumber: string
     - date: date
     - startTime: time
     - endTime: time
     - labName: string
     - labRegistrationNumber: string
     - changeCancellationFee: double

6. Lab
   - Attributes:
     - address: string
     - businessHours: string
     - registrationNumber: string
     - fee: double

### Additional Notes:
- The classes and attributes mentioned above are derived from the provided description of the LabTracker software.
- The relationships between the classes (e.g., associations, aggregations) are not explicitly defined in this model.
- The model can be further expanded and refined based on specific requirements and functionalities of the software.

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:### Enumerations:
1. TestType(BLOOD, ULTRASOUND, XRAY, URINE, STOOL):Represents different types of tests that can be prescribed by doctors.
2. RepetitionInterval(WEEKLY, MONTHLY, HALF_YEARLY, YEARLY):Specifies the intervals at which tests on a requisition are to be repeated.
3. TestResult(NEGATIVE, POSITIVE):Denotes the possible results of each test.

### Classes:
1. Doctor(practitionerNumber: numeric, signature: image, fullName: string, address: string, phoneNumber: string):Represents a doctor managing requisitions for tests and examinations.
2. Patient(healthNumber: alphanumeric, firstName: string, lastName: string, dateOfBirth: date, address: string, phoneNumber: string):Represents a patient booking appointments for tests and examinations at a lab.
3. Requisition(doctor: Doctor, patient: Patient, tests: List<Test>, repeatTimes: int, repetitionInterval: RepetitionInterval):Represents a requisition containing information about tests prescribed by a doctor for a patient.
4. Test(testType: TestType, duration: int):Represents a test that can be prescribed on a requisition.
5. Appointment(labAddress: string, labBusinessHours: string, confirmationNumber: string, date: date, startTime: time, endTime: time, labName: string, labRegistrationNumber: string, changeCancellationFee: double):Represents an appointment made by a patient for a test or examination at a lab.
6. Lab(address: string, businessHours: string, registrationNumber: string, fee: double):Represents a lab where tests and examinations are conducted.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. TestType (BLOOD, ULTRASOUND, XRAY, OTHER): Represents the different types of tests that can be prescribed by a doctor on a requisition.
2. RepetitionInterval (WEEKLY, MONTHLY, HALF_YEARLY, YEARLY): Defines the intervals at which tests on a requisition can be repeated.
3. TestResult (NEGATIVE, POSITIVE): Indicates the result of each test as either negative or positive.

### Classes:
1. Doctor(practitionerNumber: numeric, signature: image, fullName: string, address: string, phoneNumber: string): Represents a doctor who can create test requisitions for patients.
2. Patient(healthNumber: alpha-numeric, firstName: string, lastName: string, dateOfBirth: date, address: string, phoneNumber: string): Represents a patient who can book appointments for tests at a lab.
3. TestRequisition(doctor: Doctor, patient: Patient, tests: List<Test>, startDate: date, repetitionInterval: RepetitionInterval, repetitionTimes: int): Represents a requisition for tests created by a doctor for a patient.
4. Test(type: TestType, duration: int): Represents an individual test with its type and duration.
5. Appointment(lab: Lab, confirmationNumber: string, date: date, startTime: time, endTime: time, changeCancellationFee: double): Represents an appointment booked by a patient for a test at a lab.
6. Lab(address: string, businessHours: List<BusinessHour>, registrationNumber: string, testsOffered: List<TestType>, fees: Map<TestType, double>): Represents a lab where tests can be conducted.
7. BusinessHour(day: DayOfWeek, startTime: time, endTime: time): Represents the business hours of a lab on a specific day.

AI:Enumerations:
1. TestType { BloodTest, Ultrasound, XRay, Other }: Represents different types of tests that can be requested on a requisition.
2. RepetitionInterval { Weekly, Monthly, HalfYearly, Yearly }: Defines the intervals at which tests on a requisition can be repeated.

Classes:
1. Doctor(practitionerNumber: int, signature: Image, fullName: String, address: String, phoneNumber: String): Represents a doctor who can create requisitions for tests.
2. Patient(healthNumber: String, firstName: String, lastName: String, dateOfBirth: Date, address: String, phoneNumber: String): Represents a patient for whom tests are requisitioned.
3. Requisition(doctor: Doctor, patient: Patient, tests: List<Test>, startDate: Date, repetitionCount: int, repetitionInterval: RepetitionInterval): Represents a requisition created by a doctor for a patient with details of tests and repetition information.
4. Test(testType: TestType, duration: Duration): Represents a specific test with its type and duration information.
5. Lab(address: String, businessHours: BusinessHours, registrationNumber: String): Represents a lab where tests are conducted with address and business hours information.
6. Appointment(requisition: Requisition, lab: Lab, confirmationNumber: String, date: Date, startTime: Time, endTime: Time, changeCancellationFee: double): Represents an appointment made by a patient for a requisition at a lab with details such as time and fees.
7. TestResult(test: Test, result: TestResultType, report: String): Represents the result of a test with the outcome and accompanying report.
8. BusinessHours(startTime: Time, endTime: Time): Represents the business hours of a lab with start and end times.
9. Time(hour: int, minute: int): Represents a specific time with hours and minutes.
10. Duration(hours: int, minutes: int): Represents the duration of a test in terms of hours and minutes.
11. TestResultType { Negative, Positive }: Represents the possible outcomes of a test result.

The confirmation for an appointment also shows a confirmation number, the date as well as start/end times, and the name of the lab as well as its registration number. It is possible to change or cancel an appointment at any time but doing so within 24 hours of the appointment incurs a change/cancellation fee. Each lab determines its own fee and business hours. All labs are open every day of the year and offer all tests. The business hours of a lab do not change from one week to the next. Each day a lab is open from the day?? start time to its end time, i.e., there are no breaks.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The LabTracker software helps (i) doctors manage the requisition of tests and examinations for patients and (ii) patients book appointments for tests and examinations at a lab. For the remainder of this description, tests and examinations are used interchangeably. 

For a requisition, a doctor must provide their numeric practitioner number and signature for verification as well as their full name, their address, and their phone number. The signature is a digital signature, i.e., an image of the actual signature of the doctor. Furthermore, the doctor indicates the date from which the requisition is valid. The requisition must also show the patient?? information including their alpha-numeric health number, first name and last name, date of birth, address, and phone number. A doctor cannot prescribe a test for themselves but can prescribe tests to someone else who is a doctor. 

Several tests can be combined on one requisition but only if they belong to the same group of tests. For example, only blood tests can be combined on one requisition or only ultrasound examinations can be combined. It is not possible to have a blood test and an ultrasound examination on the same requisition. For each test, its duration is defined by the lab network, so that it is possible to schedule appointments accordingly. The duration of a test is the same at each lab. For some kinds of tests, it does not matter how many tests are performed. They take as long as a single test. For example, several blood tests can be performed on a blood sample, i.e., it takes as long to draw the blood sample for a single blood test as it does for several blood tests. 

A doctor may also indicate that the tests on a requisition are to be repeated for a specified number of times and interval. The interval is either weekly, monthly, every half year, or yearly. All tests on a requisition are following the same repetition pattern. 

The doctor and the patient can view the results of each test (either negative or positive) as well as the accompanying report. 

A patient is required to make an appointment for some tests while others are walk-in only. For example, x-ray examinations require an appointment, but blood tests are walk-in only (i.e., it is not possible to make an appointment for a blood test). On the other hand, some tests only require a sample to be dropped off (e.g., a urine or stool sample). 

To make an appointment for a requisition, a patient selects the desired lab based on the lab?? address and business hours. For requisitions with repeated tests, a patient is only allowed to make one appointment at a time. The confirmation for an appointment also shows a confirmation number, the date as well as start/end times, and the name of the lab as well as its registration number. It is possible to change or cancel an appointment at any time but doing so within 24 hours of the appointment incurs a change/cancellation fee. Each lab determines its own fee and business hours. All labs are open every day of the year and offer all tests. The business hours of a lab do not change from one week to the next. Each day a lab is open from the day?? start time to its end time, i.e., there are no breaks.

3. TestResult(NEGATIVE, POSITIVE): Indicates the result of a test as either negative or positive.

Classes:
1. Doctor(practitionerNumber: numeric, signature: Image, fullName: string, address: string, phoneNumber: string): Represents a doctor who can requisition tests for patients.
2. Patient(healthNumber: alpha-numeric, firstName: string, lastName: string, dateOfBirth: date, address: string, phoneNumber: string): Represents a patient who can book appointments for tests and examinations at a lab.
3. Requisition(doctor: Doctor, patient: Patient, tests: List<TestType>, validFromDate: date, repeatTimes: int, repeatInterval: RepetitionInterval): Represents a requisition for tests/examinations provided by a doctor for a patient.
4. Test(type: TestType, duration: int): Represents a specific test/examination with its type and duration.
5. TestResult(test: Test, result: TestResult, report: string): Represents the result of a test including the test details, result, and accompanying report.
6. Lab(address: string, businessHours: string, registrationNumber: string, testsOffered: List<TestType>, appointmentRequiredTests: List<TestType>, walkInOnlyTests: List<TestType>): Represents a lab where tests/examinations can be conducted and appointments can be made.
7. Appointment(lab: Lab, confirmationNumber: string, date: date, startTime: time, endTime: time, changeCancellationFee: decimal): Represents an appointment made by a patient for a test/examination at a lab.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The LabTracker software helps (i) doctors manage the requisition of tests and examinations for patients and (ii) patients book appointments for tests and examinations at a lab. For the remainder of this description, tests and examinations are used interchangeably. 

For a requisition, a doctor must provide their numeric practitioner number and signature for verification as well as their full name, their address, and their phone number. The signature is a digital signature, i.e., an image of the actual signature of the doctor. Furthermore, the doctor indicates the date from which the requisition is valid. The requisition must also show the patient?? information including their alpha-numeric health number, first name and last name, date of birth, address, and phone number. A doctor cannot prescribe a test for themselves but can prescribe tests to someone else who is a doctor. 

Several tests can be combined on one requisition but only if they belong to the same group of tests. For example, only blood tests can be combined on one requisition or only ultrasound examinations can be combined. It is not possible to have a blood test and an ultrasound examination on the same requisition. For each test, its duration is defined by the lab network, so that it is possible to schedule appointments accordingly. The duration of a test is the same at each lab. For some kinds of tests, it does not matter how many tests are performed. They take as long as a single test. For example, several blood tests can be performed on a blood sample, i.e., it takes as long to draw the blood sample for a single blood test as it does for several blood tests. 

A doctor may also indicate that the tests on a requisition are to be repeated for a specified number of times and interval. The interval is either weekly, monthly, every half year, or yearly. All tests on a requisition are following the same repetition pattern. 

The doctor and the patient can view the results of each test (either negative or positive) as well as the accompanying report. 

A patient is required to make an appointment for some tests while others are walk-in only. For example, x-ray examinations require an appointment, but blood tests are walk-in only (i.e., it is not possible to make an appointment for a blood test). On the other hand, some tests only require a sample to be dropped off (e.g., a urine or stool sample). 

To make an appointment for a requisition, a patient selects the desired lab based on the lab?? address and business hours. For requisitions with repeated tests, a patient is only allowed to make one appointment at a time. The confirmation for an appointment also shows a confirmation number, the date as well as start/end times, and the name of the lab as well as its registration number. It is possible to change or cancel an appointment at any time but doing so within 24 hours of the appointment incurs a change/cancellation fee. Each lab determines its own fee and business hours. All labs are open every day of the year and offer all tests. The business hours of a lab do not change from one week to the next. Each day a lab is open from the day?? start time to its end time, i.e., there are no breaks.
